Gubernur Kalteng Lempar Botol, Kemendagri: Sudah Diselesaikan
03 Nov 2019, 04:37 by Tempo.co, Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Tindakan Gubernur Kalimantan Tengah Sugianto Sabran melakukan pelemparan botol di Stadion Tuah Pahoe saat menyaksikan laga Kalteng Putra melawan Persib Bandung dalam lanjutan Liga 1 2019 pada Jumat, 1 November 2019, langsung direspons oleh Kementerian Dalam Negeri (Kemendagri).
Kepala Pusat Penerangan Kementerian Dalam Negeri Bahtiar mengaku sudah turun tangan menyelesaikan persoalan Gubernur Kalimantan Tengah itu. “Sudah langsung diselesaikan. Kemendagri selalu sigap, cepat mengambil upaya penyelesaian apapun terkait stabilitas dalam negeri,” kata Bahtiar dalam pesan singkat kepada Tempo, Ahad, 3 November 2019.
Aksi Sugianto itu menjadi viral di media sosial. Orang nomor satu di Kalimantan Tengah itu menuai kritik dari netizen.
Aksi negatif Sugianto yang terjadi dalam laga yang dimenangi Persib 2-0 itu terekam video, dan kemudian menjadi viral di dunia maya. Pada video itu terlihat ulah Sugianto berada di tribun VVIP Stadion Tuah Pahoe, Jalan Tjilik Riwut, Palangka Raya. Menenakan kaus warna oranye dan topi warna hitam, ia terlihat melempar botol air mineral ke arah lapangan.
Sugianto juga terlihat marah-marah sambil menunjuk-nunjuk sebelum turun dari tribun VVIP ke pinggir lapangan. Ia menghampiri Kapolres Palangka Raya Ajun Komisaris Besar, Timbul Siregar, lalu memarahinya.
Bahtiar mengatakan kementeriannya segera menyelesaikan masalah begitu insiden terjadi. Terbukti, kata dia, Gubernur Kalimantan Tengah kini sudah meminta maaf kepada Kapolres Palangka Raya setelah insiden. Sehingga, masalahnya kini sudah selesai.
Upaya penyelesaian itu, Bahtiar menuturkan bukan dalam bentuk teguran secara terbuka dan tertulis karena teguran tidak akan menyelesaikan masalah dan malah akan memperlebar persoalan. “Senyap saja, yang penting masalah selesai demi ketenteraman warga masyarakat kita,” ucap dia.
Sebelumnya, Ketua Umum PSSI Mochamad Iriawan atau Iwan Bule menegaskan bahwa tindakan Gubernur Kalimantan Tengah itu tidak boleh dilakukan. "Nanti akan kami evaluasi hukuman apa yang diberikan," kata Iwan Bule di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.

Central Kalimantan Governor Throwing Bottles, Ministry of Home Affairs: Completed
03 Nov 2019, 04:37 by Tempo.co, Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Actions of Central Kalimantan Governor Sugianto Sabran threw bottles at the Tuah Pahoe Stadium while watching the Kalteng Putra match against Persib Bandung in the continuation of League 1 2019 on Friday, November 1, 2019, immediately responded by the Ministry of Home Affairs (Kemendagri).
Head of the Ministry of Home Affairs Information Center Bahtiar claimed to have intervened to resolve the issue of the Governor of Central Kalimantan. "It was resolved immediately. The Ministry of Home Affairs has always been swift, quick to take any resolution efforts related to domestic stability, "Bahtiar said in a short message to Tempo, Sunday, November 3, 2019.
Sugianto's action went viral on social media. The number one person in Central Kalimantan has drawn criticism from netizens.
Sugianto's negative action that occurred in the match won by Persib 2-0 was captured on video, and then became viral in cyberspace. In the video, Sugianto is seen in the VVIP stands of Tuah Pahoe Stadium, Jalan Tjilik Riwut, Palangka Raya. Wearing an orange T-shirt and black hat, he was seen throwing bottles of mineral water toward the field.
Sugianto also looked angry while pointing before descending from the VVIP stands to the edge of the field. He approached the Palangka Raya Police Chief Adjunct Senior Commissioner, Timbul Siregar, then scolded him.
Bahtiar said his ministry immediately resolved the problem as soon as the incident occurred. Evidently, he said, the Governor of Central Kalimantan has now apologized to the Palangkaraya Police Chief after the incident. So, the problem is now over.
Efforts to resolve it, Bahtiar said not in the form of open and written reprimands because reprimands will not solve the problem and instead will widen the problem. "Just keep quiet, as long as the problem is solved for the sake of the peace of our citizens," he said.
Previously, PSSI General Chairman Mochamad Iriawan or Iwan Bule stressed that the actions of the Governor of Central Kalimantan should not be carried out. "We will evaluate what punishment is given later," Iwan Bule said at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
